messages.title: TOP EMPLOYERS BACK TORY PLANS TO STOP LABOUR’S TAX ON JOBS
messages.content: Gordon Brown is planning a tax rise from next April which business experts predict could cost at least 57,000 jobs in small and medium-sized businesses alone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans to block Labour's National Insurance rise which would create more jobs and cut unemployment.
Cutting £6 billion of government waste the coming year and opposing Labour’s tax on jobs.
Everyone earning between £7,100 and £45,400 will be better off by up to £150 under the Conservative proposals.
Employers will save up to £150 for everyone they employ, making it easier for them to hire new staff and keep people employed.

issues.economy: We need to create jobs to get our economy moving – but Labour’s National Insurance rise will make it more expensive for firms to hire people, risking more unemployment for longer.

leaflet.personalStatement: 7 out of 10 working people will be better off under Labour, and nobody will be worse off.

images.caption: Andrew Stephenson talking with construction workers.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is focused on criticizing Labour's tax plans and promotes Conservative policies to enhance employment and provide tax reliefs.
